meanings.definition: In a backward manner or direction.
meanings.sent1: She walked backwardly to the starting point.
meanings.sent2: He looked backwardly to see if anyone was following him.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to walk backwardly but ended up doing a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: The old clock ticked backwardly, as if time was reversing.
meanings.sent5: The car moved backwardly down the hill, gaining speed with each second.

meanings.definition: In a way that is behind in progress or development.
meanings.sent1: The technology company is falling backwardly compared to its competitors.
meanings.sent2: She felt backwardly in her career after taking a long break.
meanings.sent3: The plant grew backwardly, starting from the flower and ending at the seed.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were moving backwardly, regressing instead of advancing.
meanings.sent5: The town seemed to be stuck in time, moving backwardly while the world progressed.
